title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.3 ADOLESCENT DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: Output 2.3. Adolescent development: By 2020, improved access of adolescents to information, life skills and essential services to reduce their vulnerability to HIV, teenage pregnancy and violence., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2. By 2020, an effective and efficient well-resourced formal and non-formal quality education system that is inclusive, relevant and accessible to all boys and girls with increased school retention, completion and achievement rates.

Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents
Digital learning materials and ICT in education
Provision of skills development for adolescents (10-19 year-olds) (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of training of school communities e.g. parent teacher associations, school management committees
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
System strengthening - curricula and learning materials design (excluding early-learning / pre-primary)
System strengthening - life skills (for personal empowerment, active citizenship, etc.)
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
System strengthening for adolescent participation and civic engagement (including in humanitarian settings)
Technical assistance - Cross-sectoral communication for development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.3. Adolescent development: By 2020, improved access of adolescents to information, life skills and essential services toreduce their vulnerability to HIV, teenage pregnancy and violence.

description.narrative: In spite of the challenges posed by COVID-19, UNICEF worked to achieve results in three key areas of adolescent development: (i) continuity of learning and skills-building of in- and out-of-school adolescents; (ii) prevention and response to violence against children in schools; and (iii) increased focus on, and improved coordination of, adolescent programming by government and UNDAF partners.UNICEF helped to empower 25,361 out-of-school adolescents through formal and non-formal learning, lifeskills and citizenship education in 1,201 schools, prevention and response to violence against children in schools in 1,155 school and improved coordination on and joint programming for adolescent development and participation.;;; | Status:Met | As-of Date:13/01/2021
